basics.name: Francis Underwood
basics.label: President of the USA
basics.summary: Frank Underwood has served the US Government, holding a variety of Governmental positions. He is currently serving as the 46th President of the USA after Walker's stepping down from the Government.

work.summary: The Presidency of Frank Underwood began on October 30, 2014, when he became the 46th President of the United States, making him the second person since Gerald R. Ford to have occupied the offices of Vice President of the United States and President of the United States without having been elected to either post. Underwood will serve out the remainder of Walker's term (2014-2017), being eligible for election for one full term in November 2016 since he is serving more than half of Walker's term. He is also the first South Carolinian to occupy the White House.
highlights: Offered Presidential pardon to former President Garrett Walker

work.summary: As Vice President, Frank strongly endorsed the Military Sexual Assault bill and convinced Michael Kern, who would be later appointed Secretary of the Treasury, to help him whip the votes. President Walker resigned his presidency after his connections to China and Xander Feng were revealed. Frank was promptly sworn in as President. His first act is to renounce the asylum of Xander Feng, resulting in his deportation back to China and almost certain execution.
highlights: Took over the Vice Presidency to allow the Vice President to run for Governor of Philadelphia.

work.summary: In charge of the government's legislative procedures, drafting and passing bills, whipping votes as the Majority Leader. In this position Frank Underwood managed to pass the controversial educational bill, which promoted tough, but much needed reforms in the field of public education in the USA. Despite a long-lasting strike on behalf of educationalists, the bill was finally enforced into law
highlights: Passed the Education Bill under Garrett Walker's Presidency

volunteer.summary: Organized several charity events for the Clear Water Initiative, run by Claire Underwood, in all of the US.

awards.title: Whip of the Decade
awards.summary: For Frank Underwood's unquestionable ethos in matters concerning the legislative body of our Nation.

publications.name: The Corridors of Power
publications.summary: "The Corridors of Power" is a most piece of writing exploring the innermost depths and most primitive desires of human existence. The human pathos presented in all its majesty. Power, wealth, patriotism. The road to success, finding your path to the top through a reality of weakness. Our deepest desires and secretmost thoughts all explored in a semi-biographical novel by F. Underwood

references.name: Garrett Walker
references.reference: Frank Underwood has exhibited an exemplary political ethos, serving by my side as the Whip of US Parliament and the Vice President of the USA.

references.name: Donald Blythe
references.reference: Frank Underwood has demonstrated a deep knowledge in issues regarding both education itself as well as the needs of educationalists and students alike.
